messages.title: Thank you!
messages.content:
Campaigner Martin Luckhurst has thanked everyone who took the time to vote for him at the recent local election. The number of people voting Green in the Willes area quadrupled from four years ago. Martin congratulated the winning candidate before saying:

'I was humbled by the support and encouragement I received—thank you. It wasn't enough to win this time, but I love South Leamington and will continue to work hard to get things done and stand up for the area. Please do contact me with any suggestions about how to improve your street or community.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bringing proper local infrastructure for 21st century so we’re not stuck in a traffic jam and making sure we work together to hand on an economy and an environment that will benefit our children.

issues.brexitEurope: with Theresa May’s damaging version of Brexit? It removes rights at work and environmental protections and erodes the rights of a huge number of people.
issues.economy: Bringing housing market back into reach of ordinary people and making sure we work together to hand on an economy.
issues.environment: an economy and an environment that will benefit our children.
issues.transport: Local Infrastructure for 21st century so we’re not stuck in a traffic jam.

community.content: Pigeon Poo Protest! The battle to sort out the Pigeon poo under the Clemens St / High Street railway bridge has finally moved forward a step. Green Councillors have received a legal opinion from the Council. Case law indicates that Network Rail who own the bridge must pay to stop the pigeon nuisance.

leaflet.personalStatement: I love South Leamington and will continue to work hard to get things done and stand up for the area.

politicalExperience.achievements: received a legal opinion from the Council regarding the pigeon nuisance under the Clemens St / High Street railway bridge.

contactInformation.address: FREEPOST RTAB-HJEA-LUAS, 6 Waverley Rd, Leamington Spa, CV31 2DT

endorsements.endorsement: I’ve known Jonathan Chilvers for three years and have huge respect for his integrity, hard work and the way he consistently stands up for residents. He’s the right man for the job.

images.caption: Jonathan Chilvers and Martin Luckhurst on Moncrieff Drive near Asda.
